meanings.definition: To cause someone to be no longer close or affectionate with someone else.
meanings.sent1: His constant lies estranges his friends.
meanings.sent2: The argument estranges the siblings from each other.
meanings.sent3: The silly prank estranges them temporarily, but they will make up soon.
meanings.sent4: The misunderstanding estranges them like a wide river between two lands.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal estranges a once unbreakable bond.

meanings.sent1: Her rude behavior estranges her colleagues at work.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words estrange him from his family.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat estranges itself from the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: The dark secret estranges her from the community like a shadow following her.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules estrange the students from enjoying their learning experience.
